turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello, I'd like to interest you in committing to a donation towards the Save the Children fund, an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I appreciate your concern.  Tell me more about this charity before I make a decision.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children is a foundation that runs world-wide with a focus on providing health, education, protection, hunger elimination, emergency aid, and global advocacy. So far we have reached 155 million children in 120 countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Interesting that you know so much.  How long has this charity been around?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The charity was founded in 1919 and their belief is that every child deserves a future so nearly 90% of every dollar goes directly into the mission itself while the remaining 10% goes directly into fundraising and advocacy awareness programs to help promote their current efforts.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That is important that most of the money goes to the charity and not into administration.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Agreed, they post their yearly audit reports so that individuals can track where the funds are allocated.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: It looks like they will be celebrating their 100 year anniversary soon. That is quite a milestone.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, they are an extremely reputable charity that have been in good standing for the entirety of their history. Originally founded immediately after World War I when so many children were orphaned and/or homeless.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That is interesting.  Do they do work in the United States or just overseas?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: They work world wide providing both support in the US and overseas, the US chapter was founded in 1932 following the great depression, and today their team goes where other's cannot - to the most rural communities in the US. Last year, they provided support to 237,000 US children across 22 states and Puerto Rico.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What country outside of the US do they do the most help for?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Other than the US, Africa receives 43% of the budget, helping more than 32 million children in 2016 across Burkina Faso, Burundi, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Guinea, Kenya, Liberia, Malawi, Mali, Mozambique, Niger, Nigeria, Rwanda, Sierra Leone, Somalia, South Sudan, Sudan, Tanzania, Uganda, Zambia, and Zimbabwe.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Interesting. Yes I see that most children are helped in Africa.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Right. So, can I interest you in making a donation from your reward today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Although I do appreciate all of your info, I am not interested in making a donation at this time.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Are you certain? Just a small donation can make a large impact on the entire life of a child and allow them to receive proper medical care and education, food and safety.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I understand, but I already have charities that I support on my own.  Thank you, but no.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Ok, I thank you very much for your consideration!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: You are more than welcome.
